knowledgeTasks.name: HR Assist
knowledgeTasks.description: This is used to make ontology

faqs.question: When can I expect my annual form W2?

alternateQuestions.question: What is the estimated date for receiving my W2 form?
When will I receive my W2 form for this year?
Can you tell me when my W2 form will be issued?
How long does it usually take to receive a W2 form?
Will my W2 form be sent to me or do I have to pick it up?
What is the usual timeframe for W2 forms to be distributed?
Is there a way to check the status of my W2 form or when it will be sent?

faqs.label: When can I expect my annual form W2?

answer.text: All employee W2s are mailed on or around January 31st for the prior calendar year.

faqs.question: How do I print W2 form?

alternateQuestions.question: What is the process for printing a W2 form?
Could you show me the steps for printing a W2 form?
What are the instructions for printing a W2 form?
I need to print my W2 form. Can you tell me how to do it?
I'm trying to print my W2 form. Could you help me with that?

faqs.label: How do I print W2 form?

answer.text: To print W2 form from the HR portal.

faqs.question: Who do I contact for general on-line W4 questions?

alternateQuestions.question: Who should I get in touch with regarding general online W4 inquiries?
What is the contact information for general online W4 questions?
Can you provide me with the contact details for general online W4 support?
Is there a specific department or person I should contact for online W4 questions?
How can I reach out to someone for assistance with online W4 questions?
What is the customer support contact for online W4 questions?
Where can I find information on who to contact for online W4 assistance?
Can you direct me to the appropriate resource for general online W4 queries?
I have some general questions about my online W4. Who should I reach out to for help?

faqs.label: Who do I contact for general on-line W4 questions?

answer.text: You can contact the Payroll Help desk at 1-7575 for W4 questions.

alternateQuestions.question: How would you describe a primary caregiver?
Can you explain what a primary caregiver is?
What exactly does the term primary caregiver refer to?
Who is considered a primary caregiver?
What does the term "primary caregiver" mean?

answer.text: We consider someone the primary caregiver if he or she has primary responsibility for the care of a child immediately following the birth or the coming of the child into the custody, care and control of the parent for the first time. This definition applies to both births and adoptions.

alternateQuestions.question: Who is responsible for identifying the primary caregiver?
Who decides who the primary caregiver is?
How is the primary caregiver determined?
Who designates the primary caregiver?
Who has the final say in determining the primary caregiver?
What is the process for determining the primary caregiver?
I'm not sure who decides who the primary caregiver is. Can you provide some information on that?
What factors are considered in determining who the primary caregiver is, and who makes that decision?

answer.text: The staff member determines who in his or her family is the primary caregiver by signing an affidavit as part of the Paid Parental Leave Request form.

faqs.question: For how long I can take Paid Parental Leave?

alternateQuestions.question: How long am I eligible for Paid Parental Leave?
What is the duration of Paid Parental Leave?
Can you tell me the time limit for Paid Parental Leave?
What is the maximum amount of time I can take for Paid Parental Leave?
How much time off can I get for Paid Parental Leave?
Is there a limit to how long I can take Paid Parental Leave?
What are policy for paid parental leave?

faqs.label: For how long I can take Paid Parental Leave?

answer.text: Paid Parental Leave is designed to provide staff time and financial support to adjust to the addition of a new family member during the important period immediately following the birth or adoption of a child. Staff members are eligible to receive Paid Parental Leave during the first 12 weeks following the birth or adoption of a child. (In order to receive the full paid benefit, a staff member would need to begin his or her leave by the sixth week following a birth or adoption so he or she could take the required three consecutive weeks prior to receiving the three weeks of paid leave).What is the duration of Paid Parental Leave?

botUtterances.text: Glad I could be of some help.
Glad I could be of assistance.
Always great to be able to help.
